title: A bevy of ball terminals...
content:
at least that's what typographica says in [this article](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021213544/http:/typographi.com/001077.php), but i just had to point out that the "teardrop-shaped terminals" in Zapf Book and Perla are aptly named [lachrymal terminals](http://web.archive.org/web/20131021213544/http:/typophile.com/wiki/lachrymal%20terminal).  
sorry for nit-pickin', stewf, but that was just buggin me. \>^P
author: paul d hunt

comments.content: "If it were not for my critics, I would be nothing."
lachrymal terminals sounds so maudlin... either that or an eye disease.

There are plenty enough lachrymal terminals. I want to see more mycocene ones!

Ha ha! Obscure latinate shape names!  
mushroom MUSHROOM!

Last time I was in Scotland all of my luggage was sent to the Lachrymal terminal by mistake, thanks for asking, everything's fine now, i was missing $38.70 in cash and one of the buckles was broken but apart from that...
